description: Age-appropriate visual themes for K-2 picture-based activities

animals_pets.name: Animals & Pets
animals_pets.description: Domestic and familiar animals, pets, zoo animals, farm animals
example_contexts: Daily routines for pets (feeding, walking, grooming)
Animals by characteristics (has fur, has feathers, etc.)

visual_guidelines.style: Friendly, cartoon-style animals with expressive faces

cultural_considerations: Include diverse types of pets (not just dogs/cats)
Show animals from various climates/regions
Be mindful of cultural attitudes toward different animals
Avoid assumptions about pet ownership
sample_assets: puppy, kitten, bunny, hamster, fish, bird

food_cooking.name: Food & Cooking
food_cooking.description: Food items, meals, cooking processes, healthy eating
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (recipe steps, making meals)
T25 - Data Representation (sorting by food group)
example_contexts: Making a sandwich or simple recipe steps
Sorting foods by category (fruits, vegetables, grains, etc.)
Healthy vs. less healthy food choices
Food preparation steps (wash, cut, mix, cook)

visual_guidelines.avoid: Junk food as primary focus, messy or unappealing food

cultural_considerations: Include diverse foods from many cultures
Be mindful of dietary restrictions (vegetarian, halal, kosher, etc.)
Don't emphasize sugary foods/candy
Show variety in meal styles across cultures
Be sensitive to food insecurity issues
sample_assets: mixing bowl, spoon, plate, cup, napkin

home_family.name: Home & Family
home_family.description: Home environments, family activities, daily routines, household items
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (morning routines, bedtime routines)
T03 - Decomposition (parts of a house, chores breakdown)
example_contexts: Morning routine sequences (wake up, brush teeth, get dressed, eat)

visual_guidelines.avoid: Stereotypical gender roles, single family structure only

cultural_considerations: Show diverse family structures (single parent, two parents, grandparents, etc.)
Include various home types (apartments, houses, etc.)
Represent different cultural home environments
Avoid assumptions about family wealth or resources
Show different cultural routines and practices
Inclusive of all family types (adoption, foster, blended, etc.)

school_classroom.name: School & Classroom
school_classroom.description: School settings, classroom activities, learning materials, school routines
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (classroom routines, lining up)
T03 - Decomposition (parts of the school day)
T32 - Cybersecurity (safe computer use at school)
cultural_considerations: Show diverse students and teachers
Include various learning styles and abilities
Represent different school types and resources
Show inclusive classroom practices
Avoid assumptions about school resources
sample_assets: diverse students of various abilities and backgrounds
classroom areas (reading corner, computer station, etc.)

nature_weather.name: Nature & Weather
nature_weather.description: Natural world, weather, seasons, plants, outdoor environments
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (planting seeds, life cycles)
T03 - Decomposition (parts of plants, weather elements)

visual_guidelines.size: Clear weather icons and nature elements
visual_guidelines.avoid: Severe weather that might frighten, pollution focus

cultural_considerations: Include diverse climate zones
Show weather/seasons relevant to different regions
Be mindful that not all students experience four seasons
Include diverse outdoor activities and clothing

transportation.name: Transportation
transportation.description: Vehicles, modes of travel, transportation systems, movement
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (getting to school, travel routes)
T25 - Data Representation (sorting vehicles by type)

visual_guidelines.avoid: Vehicle crashes or accidents, scary vehicles

cultural_considerations: Show diverse transportation modes (not just cars)
Include walking, biking, public transit
Represent transportation from various regions
Be mindful that not all families have cars
Include accessibility vehicles (wheelchair-accessible buses, etc.)
sample_assets: car, bus, school bus, train, subway

toys_play.name: Toys & Play
toys_play.description: Toys, games, playground activities, play materials
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (game rules, play sequences)
T03 - Decomposition (parts of games, toy categories)

visual_guidelines.avoid: Expensive or branded toys, weapons, gender-stereotyped toys

cultural_considerations: Show diverse types of toys and games from various cultures
Include traditional games from different regions
Avoid gender stereotypes (boys/girls toys)
Show toys at various price points
Include imaginative play, outdoor play, creative play
sample_assets: blocks, puzzle, ball, doll, stuffed animal

community_helpers.name: Community Helpers
community_helpers.description: People in the community, jobs, helpers, community places
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (job procedures, community routines)
T25 - Data Representation (matching helpers to tools)
T30 - Hardware (tools and technology helpers use)
T34 - History of Computing (technology in different jobs)
example_contexts: Matching community helpers to their tools
Where we go in the community (library, store, etc.)

visual_guidelines.style: Diverse, friendly representations of community members

cultural_considerations: Show racial, ethnic, and gender diversity in all roles
Include people with disabilities in helper roles
Represent various cultural community structures
Show variety of community places (urban, suburban, rural)
Include diverse family-owned businesses
Be mindful of differing relationships with authority figures across cultures
sample_assets: mail carrier, sanitation worker, bus driver
community buildings (library, fire station, hospital, store, school)
tools: stethoscope, fire hose, books, mail, etc.

seasons_holidays.name: Seasons & Holidays
seasons_holidays.description: Seasonal activities, celebrations, holidays, special events
appropriate_topics: T01 - Everyday Algorithms (holiday preparations, seasonal activities)
cultural_considerations: Include diverse cultural celebrations
Focus on secular seasonal changes when possible
Acknowledge not all students celebrate the same holidays
Include celebrations from various cultures
Be mindful of varying family traditions
Consider families who don't celebrate certain holidays
sample_assets: seasonal trees (blooming, full, falling leaves, bare)
seasonal weather (spring rain, summer sun, fall leaves, winter snow)

colors_shapes.name: Colors & Shapes
colors_shapes.description: Basic geometric shapes, colors, patterns, spatial relationships
appropriate_topics: T27 - Data Analysis (counting and grouping shapes)
example_contexts: Sorting by multiple attributes (color AND shape)

visual_guidelines.colors: Primary and secondary colors, high contrast
visual_guidelines.avoid: Complex or ambiguous shapes, muddy colors

cultural_considerations: Shapes are generally universal
Be aware of color symbolism in different cultures
Include shapes in cultural patterns and art
Use colors accessibly (consider color blindness)
sample_assets: circle, square, triangle, rectangle, oval, diamond, star, heart
red, blue, yellow, green, orange, purple, pink, brown, black, white

technology_devices.name: Technology & Devices
technology_devices.description: Computing devices, digital tools, technology in daily life
appropriate_topics: T33 - Platforms & APIs (different devices and platforms)

visual_guidelines.style: Modern but not overly specific device models
visual_guidelines.avoid: Specific brands, outdated technology, very expensive devices only

cultural_considerations: Show variety of devices (not just latest/most expensive)
Include assistive technology
Show technology in diverse settings
Be aware not all students have access to same technology
Include communal/shared technology (library computers, etc.)
Show technology used in various cultural contexts
sample_assets: parts: screen, keys, buttons, cable, plug
icons: wifi, power, volume, home button
various uses: learning, communicating, creating, playing

best_practices: Match theme to learning objective (use relevant, meaningful contexts)
Consider student interest and engagement levels
Rotate themes to maintain variety and engagement
Use familiar contexts before introducing unfamiliar ones
Ensure themes are culturally responsive and inclusive
Choose themes that work well visually (clear, distinct images)
Consider prerequisite knowledge (do students know these items?)
accessibility_considerations: High contrast between items and background
Distinct shapes and outlines (not just color differences)

grade_1.rationale: Expanding world beyond home, more school focus

grade_2.rationale: More abstract thinking, broader community awareness, technology comfort

theme_pairing_suggestions.description: Some skills work well with multiple theme options

image_requirements.resolution: Minimum 150x150px for small items, 300x300px for featured items
image_requirements.detail_level: Simple but recognizable, not overly detailed
image_requirements.edges: Clear, defined edges for easy recognition

guidelines: Describe what's visible, not what it represents conceptually
Keep it brief (1-5 words for K-2)
